means: 巴思（英格兰西南部的一座市镇，在布里斯托尔港的东南面。以其乔治王朝的建筑和温泉而著名。这些温泉是公元 1世纪古罗马人开凿的。是一颇受青睐的疗养胜地。人口84， 100 ）
bacterial adherence to hydrocarbon 细菌对碳氢化合物的粘连

word_mean: 浴：浴剂：一种传导或对流介质，如水，蒸气，沙或湿泥，用以洗濯，或部分或全身浸入其中，达到治疗或清洁目的。又称balneum
沐浴：使用传导或对流介质于身体，以达治疗或清洁目的
浴器：身体或物件可浸于内的设备或科学仪器

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  bæth, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch bad and German Bad

entry.def: A bath is a container, usually a long rectangular one, which you fill with water and sit in while you wash your body.

example.ex: In those days, only quite wealthy families had baths of their own.
example.tran: 那时候，只有非常富有的家庭才有自己的浴缸。

entry.def: When you have or take a bath, or when you are in the bath, you sit or lie in a bath filled with water in order to wash your body.

example.ex: ...if you have a bath every morning...
Take a shower instead of a bath.

entry.def: If you bath someone, especially a child, you wash them in a bath.

example.ex: Don't feel you have to bath your child every day.

entry.def: When you bath, you have a bath.

example.ex: The three children all bath in the same bath water.
example.tran: 这三个小孩用同一盆水洗澡。

entry.tran: 澡堂；（附带泳池的）公共浴室
entry.def: A bath or a baths is a public building containing a swimming pool, and sometimes other facilities that people can use to have a wash or a bath.

example.ex: One of the most important buildings in this ruined city is a public bath...
example.tran: 在这座被毁坏的城市里，最重要的建筑物之一就是公共澡堂。

example.ex: As well as a Roman amphitheatre and baths, the town has two superb museums.
example.tran: 除了罗马式圆形剧场和公共浴池，这个镇上还有两座非常好的博物馆。

entry.def: A bath is a container filled with a particular liquid, such as a dye or an acid, in which particular objects are placed, usually as part of a manufacturing or chemical process.

example.ex: ...a developing photograph placed in a bath of fixer.
example.tran: 放在定影液中冲洗的照片

means.word_mean: 1. a vessel containing liquid in which something is immersed (as to process it or to maintain it at a constant temperature or to lubricate it);

sentences.sentence: "she soaked the etching in an acid bath"

means.word_mean: 2. you soak your body in a bathtub;

sentences.sentence: "he has a good bath every morning"

means.word_mean: 3. a relatively large open container that you fill with water and use to wash the body
4. an ancient Hebrew liquid measure equal to about 10 gallons
5. a room (as in a residence) containing a bath or shower and usually a washbasin and toilet
1. clean one's body by immersion into water;

sentences.en: I used to take a bath twice a day last year, morning and night.
sentences.cn: 去年我一天洗两次澡, 早晚各一次。

sentences.en: She bathed her toddlers in tubs.
sentences.cn: 她在浴缸里给小孩子们洗澡。

jushi.english: He wants into the bath to take a shower.
I shall have a hot bath and go to bed.
jushi.chinese: 我要洗个热水澡,然后睡觉。

jushi.english: She instructed her maid to get her bath ready.
jushi.chinese: 她通知侍女给她准备洗澡水。
